item.title: [317] Pk Point Leaderboard
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

You can make it work, the very first line of your code needs to be altered for starters:

public int totalz = totalz = (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[22]));

replace the getLevelForXP stuff with the pkpoint one

and then the same for the last line of your code…

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Pk Point Leaderboard
item.dc:creator: @_Ryan3 _Ryan
item.description:
@_Ryan3 wrote:

Ok, so I’m trying to make a Pk Point leaderboard, (Delta Source)
Anyway I’m using the following code

[code]
public int totalz = totalz = (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[22]));
//In-game highscores
public int playerRank = 0;

public void resetRanks() {
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
server.ranks[i] = 0;
server.rankPpl[i] = “”;
if (playerRights >= 2) {
playerRank = 0;
totalz = 0;
}
}
}
public void highscores() {
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@dbl@", 8144); //Title
sendQuest("@dre@~In-Game Top 10 Highscores~By:Ahmedo0o~", 8145);
for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { // you also need to change this for it to display more, simply the number you want it to display, say 20 = for(int i = 0; i < 20; i++)
if(server.ranks[i] > 0) {
sendQuest("@bla@Rank “+(i+1)+”: @red@"+server.rankPpl[i]+ "@bla@ - Total Lvl:@whi@ " +server.ranks[i], 8147+i);
}
}
sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();
resetRanks();
}
//end highscores[/code]
And

[code] //in-game highscores
playerLevel[24] = totalz;
if (playerRights >= 2) {
playerRank = 0;
totalz = 0;
}

for (int d = 0; d <= 10; d++) {
    if (totalz >= server.ranks[d]) {
        if (d == 0) {
            playerRank = d+1;
            server.ranks[d] = totalz;
            server.rankPpl[d] = playerName;
        }else if (d < 10){
            if (totalz < server.ranks[d-1]) {
                playerRank = d+1;
                server.ranks[d] = totalz;
                server.rankPpl[d] = playerName;
            }
        }else{
            if (totalz < server.ranks[d-1]) {
                playerRank = 0;
            }
        }
    }
}
//end highscores

int oldtotal = totalz;
totalz = (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]));[/code]

Then in the server class

public static int[] ranks = new int[11]; public static String[] rankPpl = new String[11];

But I really need to know how I can change this so it shows the total amount of

pkpoints

A player has.

Should I continue to use this, or scrap it?
Someone want to give me some advice here.

Read full topic
